title: Emails in Thunderbird now show coding instead of emails.
creator: bobsauve
content:
In Thunderbird for Windows 10 desktop, when I look at certain emails between certain dates, they display unrelated coded emails. This occurs on all my email from February 3rd to February 23rd. The last occurence is 10:23am on the 23rd. My emaill at 10:25pm is where it returns to normal. I have attached a screenshot for reference. To reiterate, the coding in the body of the email has nothing to do with the original email and some of the emails have been stripped of their content completely.

I should mention, these were showing normally originally. If I look on my phone email app, they are showing as they should be.

Version - 124.0b1 (64-bit)

Thanks Bob

title: Font size of mail list in inbox and other folders
creator: boitel
content:
The listing of my inbox and other mail folders changed so that the type face is smaller and the rows are further apart. I went to the controls that permit increasing and decreasing mail listing font sizes. It shows the font size to be 7. Pressing the increase and decrease buttons has no effect. Pressing the density buttons has some effect, but the rows are still too far apart.

I found the tip sheet that recognizes there can be a such a problem. I entered the suggested commands in the config editor. No button appeared to revert to the standard configuration for the text size and density.

Thank you for any help you can provide. HJB

title: search broken in version 115.8.0 (32-bit)
creator: ronald3
content: Search does not work right. I find the latest update to be impossible to use. It comes up with a list of options that tell me nothing about what is in the emails. It use to be that It would just give me a list of emails that contain the search term listed with the latest ones at the top with the subject line and email address. I could then scroll through the list. I can not find any customization to return the old way. I have almost totally quit using search and just have to scroll through my emails to find any thing. title: Need help getting back my profile and folders
creator: blokerrick
content:
Hello everyone,

Ok here is my issue and I will try to explain as simple as possible.

I am was using cPanel to host my emails. Then Godaddy convinced me to use MS 365 for the hosting. I never really liked it and wanted to switch bak to cPanel.

Once the change was made TB kept looking tryingto Authentic the IMAP server but it could not do that. After trying to solve the problem I tried setting up a new account which I was able to do but my local folders would not move over to the new account. So I went back to my original account and changed the server details and now all of my local folders are missing inside of Thunderbird. I can see them in my profile folder and I know they are current but can't get them to populate in TB.

Can anyone help, please! This is my work email and I need to get these folders back.

THank you, Rick
